verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. Hear <S%H8085><s%> this <S%H5971><s%>, all ye peoples; Give ear <S%H238><s%>, all ye inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the world <S%H2465><s%>,
Both low <S%H1121><s%> and high <S%H1121><s%>, Rich <S%H6223><s%> and poor <S%H34><s%> together <S%H3162><s%>.
My mouth <S%H6310><s%> shall speak <S%H1696><s%> wisdom <S%H2454><s%>; And the meditation <S%H1900><s%> of my heart <S%H3820><s%> shall be of understanding <S%H8394><s%>.
I will incline <S%H5186><s%> mine ear <S%H241><s%> to a parable <S%H4912><s%>: I will open <S%H6605><s%> my dark saying <S%H2420><s%> upon the harp <S%H3658><s%>.
Wherefore should I fear <S%H3372><s%> in the days <S%H3117><s%> of evil <S%H7451><s%>, When iniquity <S%H5771><s%> at my heels <S%H6120><s%> compasseth me about <S%H5437><s%>?
They that trust <S%H982><s%> in their wealth <S%H2428><s%>, And boast <S%H1984><s%> themselves in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of their riches <S%H6239><s%>;
None of them can <S%H376><s%> by any means <S%H6299><s%> redeem <S%H6299><s%> his brother <S%H251><s%>, Nor give <S%H5414><s%> to God <S%H430><s%> a ransom for him <S%H3724><s%>;
(For the redemption <S%H6306><s%> of their life <S%H5315><s%> is costly <S%H3365><s%>, And it faileth <S%H2308><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>;)
That he should still live <S%H2421><s%> alway <S%H5331><s%>, That he should not see <S%H7200><s%> corruption <S%H7845><s%>.

For he shall see <S%H7200><s%> it <S%H2450><s%>. Wise men die <S%H4191><s%>; The fool <S%H3684><s%> and the brutish <S%H1198><s%> alike <S%H3162><s%> perish <S%H6><s%>, And leave <S%H5800><s%> their wealth <S%H2428><s%> to others <S%H312><s%>.

Their inward <S%H7130><s%> thought is <S%H1004><s%>, that their houses shall continue for ever <S%H5769><s%>, And their dwelling-places <S%H4908><s%> to all <S%H1755><s%> generations <S%H1755><s%>; They call <S%H7121><s%> their lands <S%H127><s%> after their own names <S%H8034><s%>.
But man <S%H120><s%> being in honor <S%H3366><s%> abideth <S%H3885><s%> not <S%H4911><s%>: He is like the beasts <S%H929><s%> that perish <S%H1820><s%>.
This their way <S%H1870><s%> is their folly <S%H3689><s%>: Yet after them <S%H310><s%> men approve <S%H7521><s%> their sayings <S%H6310><s%>. <S%H5542><s%>[[Selah

They are appointed <S%H8371><s%> as a flock <S%H6629><s%> for Sheol <S%H7585><s%>; Death <S%H4194><s%> shall be their shepherd <S%H7462><s%>; And the upright <S%H3477><s%> shall have dominion <S%H7287><s%> over them in the morning <S%H1242><s%>; And their beauty <S%H6697><s%> shall be for Sheol <S%H7585><s%> to consume <S%H1086><s%>, That there be no habitation for it <S%H2073><s%>.
But God <S%H430><s%> will redeem <S%H6299><s%> my soul <S%H5315><s%> from the power <S%H3027><s%> of Sheol <S%H7585><s%>; For he will receive <S%H3947><s%> me <S%H5542><s%>. [[Selah
Be not thou afraid <S%H3372><s%> when one <S%H376><s%> is made rich <S%H6238><s%>, When the glory <S%H3519><s%> of his house <S%H1004><s%> is increased <S%H7235><s%>.
For when he dieth <S%H4194><s%> he shall carry nothing away <S%H3947><s%>; His glory <S%H3519><s%> shall not descend <S%H3381><s%> after him <S%H310><s%>.
Though while he lived <S%H2416><s%> he blessed <S%H1288><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> (And men praise <S%H3034><s%> thee <S%H3190><s%>, when thou doest well to thyself,)
He shall go <S%H935><s%> to the generation <S%H1755><s%> of his fathers <S%H1><s%>; They shall never <S%H3808><s%> see <S%H7200><s%> the light <S%H216><s%>.
Man <S%H120><s%> that is in honor <S%H3366><s%>, and understandeth <S%H995><s%> not <S%H4911><s%>, Is like the beasts <S%H929><s%> that perish <S%H1820><s%>.
